text:
Hi all,
has anyone else tried using <https://github.com/jhildenbiddle/css-vars-ponyfill> for IE11 compatibility?
We're having CORS trouble because css-vars-ponyfill needs to load css files via XMLHttpRequest.

Would it be possible for HubSpot to add the necessary "Access-Control-Allow-Origin" header to the CDN's responses?

Thanks for your help!
Is there a function or anything hook into the submission of a form, I need to pass data to a thank you page on submit.
Or is there maybe a way to inline all styles for IE11 clients? I think that would solve the problem as well.

Looks like when HubSpot combines our styles (which it did not do previously) they are loaded from the same domain and css-vars-ponyfill polyfill can do its thing :+1:
But this means that a good IE11 experience is currently dependent on the styles being combined, which they not always are.
How can i make sure that my styles are always combined? Because that does not seem to work on all pages.
